# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    pattern1 = r"# Question\n?([^\n]*\n)"
    pattern2 = r"# Answer\n?([^\n]*\n)"
    match1 = match(pattern1, md)
    match2 = match(pattern2, md)
    if !isnothing(match1) && !isnothing(match2)
        question = strip(String(match1[1]))
        answer = strip(String(match2[1]))
        return (question, answer)
    end
    return nothing
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to match the text between `# Question` and `# Answer` headers in a Markdown document. It then strips leading whitespace from both the question and the answer before returning them as a tuple.
